title: Love this spot for swimming.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful little cove for swimming. My husband and I like to arrive by 9AM and lay in the sun on a towel on the beach for a little while and then rent chairs under the shade. It's a fun place to swim. Great people watching too as by 11AM-ish it starts to get pretty busy. Lots of families in the shallow water laughing and having a great time. Rental chairs are comfortable and a nice break from the sun. Excellent half day.

title: Okay not worth going out of your way for
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Pretty beach but very crowded, more of a local beach since the waves aren’t as high as other beaches. The people working at the restaurants there are not very happy with the people that go there, kinda rude. I asked for price on two lounge chairs and umbrella, 400 pesos. I keeps walking to check out other prices and on the way I bought a coconut from another vendor. I went back to the original place to get the lounge chairs since that was the best price. The guys working there glared at us with darting eyes and said “no you can’t sit here any more because you bought something from another place.” Really you’re gonna turn down $400 pesos because I spent $70 on a coconuts? Ridiculous. Over all it’s okay, if it’s on your way check it out but otherwise you’re not missing much.

title: Beautiful but busy
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Such a beautiful beach to swim in the warm turquoise waters of Mexico! The beach was easy to find and we had a relaxing time day under a beach umbrella (paid 400MXN), however we were told this was a more chill spot with less tourists but this was definitely not the case. It was absolutely packed, would’ve loved to have hired a board to surf but there were a thousand kooks out and service wasn’t great - every one avoided us and couldn’t crack a smile out of anyone lol

title: Beautiful Beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The walk down the stairs was a bit difficult for my left knee that was banged up after a violent boat ride the previous day for dolphin watching.  Once you make the walk down the 167 steps, the beach is really beautiful and worth the effort to get to.  I watched the sunset one evening, then on my last day, I took a morning swim in the ocean.  Playa Carrizalillo is a fantastic gem of a place and a must visit!

title: LOVE!!!!!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Love this area!!!!!  best loction in Puerto Escondido! It's Beautiful, cool, laidback, quiet with a cool vibe, I highly reccomend it!

title: Favorite beach in the area
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido I visited half a dozen beaches in the area, and this was by far my favorite. I went in the morning when there was plenty of shade and enjoy chilaquiles prepared on the site for a reasonaly priced breakfast. The waves were gentle enough to swim in, but there were also surfers out.

title: Crystal clear water with great snorkeling
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The best beach in Oaxaca Mexico in my opinion. The water is crystal clear and there are plenty of fish to see. It reminds me a lot of Hanauma Bay Hawaii.

title: Don't come here to surf unless you like huge crowds of beginners and angry locals
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido A nice beach, but always overcrowded. The surfing vibe is the worst I've ever seen - 50+ people out there all the time and people telling you to leave. Don't come here to surf because if you're not a local, and not Mexican, they will treat you poorly you and tell you to leave. Overall being white in Puerto Escondido means you mostly don't get treated well. Take your tourism or digital nomading elsewhere if you are white. Looks like it would be good for snorkeling.

title: Incredibly fun!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido My wife and I had the time of our lives on this beach. The clear water, the subtly dangerous waves, the weather, even the sexy people all around, made this a perfect spot to spend a day. Just choose your resting spot carefully because sudden waves may steal your sandals.

title: Beach restaurant rip off
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beach restaurant rip off
Be careful as some of the restaurants here charge to rent the chairs with the food and drinks being extra to the chair rental.  We had not experienced this elsewhere so make sure to ask what is included with the chair rental.

title: Great spot, to young for me..
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Lovely spot, but it was like an 18/ 30 holiday vibe, so if you’re into that, great, I think I’m just too old for that now..unfortunately.

title: tropical beach escape
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido beautiful tropical escape. 
go down many steps and watch the sunset. 
the water was warm & it was a great beach to chill. it's off the beaten path & because of the steps less people go there.

title: Pleasant time in the ocean
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We stayed and swam after a morning outing with Omar's Sport Fishing.  It seems to be mostly locals on this beach, although also saw some other tourists.  It is not so much a swimming location as a bob around relaxing in the water spot.  The beach is not huge and there are boats anchored nearby, but it was a really pleasant place to spend the afternoon.  I don't know that we would make a special trip (pay for taxi, etc.), but enjoyed the time since we were already there.

title: Violent surfers beware
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido I rented a surfboard there and was not told by the surfboard rentals that there are violent surfers from the rental company.  I got punched surfing on the wrong side of the beach and I was far away from every surfer not posing a threat.   He wanted to drown me…The violent surfer said this is Mexico and I tell you where to go you go or I will kill you!   The guy may work for the surfboard company because I seen him with the surfboard rental area hanging out.

title: Villas Carrizalillo
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Excellent rooms,amazing sunsets , and being situated to a fab restaurant called Espadin, made it a good location. 
Downside is the very small pool.

title: NOT THE BEST BEACH ,TO CROWDED
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido I tried to swim each day in different locale. This was my frist day visit and it was very crowded, and could really not find a good spot. Went to end and grabbed a chair at a club and ordered a beer just to cool down. Then took a long swim in calm water. This place sorry not for me

title: The most swimmable beach in Puerto Escondido.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Of all the beaches we visited this one was the only one that we got to really enjoy being in the water and got to swim a bit. It is mainly a surfing beach but there are a lot of people swimming too. The beds/chairs from the restaurants arepricey compared to other places so just sit on the sand.

title: Beautiful Beach
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Loved this beach. The water is crystal clear and relatively calm.  You can float for hours if you wish.

Take a little cash.  Best if you rent a few chairs with an umbrella and get drinks/snacks from the vendors.

We spent three days on the beach ... seemed consistently safe and friendly.

title: Boom box hell—hated it
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is our fourth trip to PE. Sadly we can’t enjoy this stunning beach because of people bringing boom boxes. I just want to read a book, swim, and watch families and couples have fun. Don’t want someone else’s music blaring from two feet away. I get it. Not my country, not my beach. But now we go to club villasol at playa Bacocho which had sparkling showers, good food, same prices, clean pools, and uncrowded beaches where boom boxes are not allowed. It’s no more expensive and the tranquility is worth it.#donewithboomboxhell

title: Beautiful  smallish beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido There is 170 odd steps to get down to this beach and then back up however the beach is beautiful, surfers and swimmers flock to small beach

title: Clean and safe
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Clean and safe with good amenities and a family-friendly beach. The vendors have a good selection  of food and drinks available.

title: A nice, peaceful beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The beach itself, sheltered in a small inlet surrounded by cliffs, offers a wonderful place to relax and also a nice spot for surfing. The water is warm and crystal clear. Amenities are available. Beach lounges for rent. Inexpensive given it is a tourist destination.

title: Beautiful and fun beach...
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Carrizalillo is closed to town... It is a great beach to swim, relax and have fun... and off course surfing classes!

title: Beautiful beach, calm waters
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is one of the best beaches I’ve ever been to! Calm, warm waters for swimming, and soft sand. Wonderful location for watching the sunset!

title: Awesome, warm and smooth waves,
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Awesome, warm and smooth waves, I didn´t want to get out. Super recommended to relax. There weren´t many people and it was clean. The services near are ok but nothing special. If you are going because of the sea and enjoying the ocean, this is a place to go.

title: Cool little beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Apt of ppl surf here I think it’s good for beginners. I like to fish on the other side of the rocks there’s a tiny little beach type area.

title: Sweet beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The view from part way down the stairs to the beach and water below was stunningly beautiful. The water was so many different colours of blue. The beach was perfect for walking; not too long or too short. It was lovely watching the surfers riding the gentle waves. Nice cardio workout climbing to the top of the stairs after spending time at the beach.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Enjoyed the day at this beautiful location.  Be prepared for the big walk down to the water. Lots of surfers, but we were able to enjoy bobbing in the water. Not a snorkel beach.  Lots of vendors to buy food but be prepared to pay for your chairs for the day.

title: Lovely swimming beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We were lucky enough to stay at a hotel on this gorgeous beach, so spent a lot of time there. The water was warm and beautiful and great for swimming or bobbing in the gentle waves. Renting loungers is a must to get some shade (the place with blue loungers was 250 for two, the next door place with orange loungers was 150 each), or claim a restaurant table and order food.

title: Great beach and great coconut shrimp
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Loved the beach. We were told it would be crowded and not one day did we feel crowded....even on the weekend. Best coconut shrimp around!!  Don’t be afraid to try the seafood. It was fantastic. Can’t remember the name but we sat at the restaurant immediately to the left after coming down the stairs

title: The steps are worth it
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Nice relaxing day at the beautiful beach with calmer waters and great service.  We paid 250 pesos for lounge chairs and umbrellas and he’d excellent service all day

title: Pretty beach but chair prices are a bit much.
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The beach is very beautiful and the stairs aren't that big a deal.  You don't get the killer views without a little bit of exercise.

Unfortunately the access to beach chairs/umbrellas here is a bit odd compared to other places I've been in Mexico.  Normally if you order food and drinks, an umbrella chair is no extra cost and the washrooms are then free.  Here the chair costs were 250-300 pesos.  Considering a 10-15 minute taxi ride in town is around 40-60 pesos the amount for a chair is a bit much.  If they set it at that amount but then deducted it from you food/beverage bill then maybe it would be okay, but as it is, we couldn't be bothered to go back after visiting once.  The food on offer wasn't the best the area has to offer either.  

The big plus for this beach is it is very calm for safely swimming, and the beach and water appeared to be very clean.

title: Wondeful swim beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is a beautiful beach. There are nice restaurants for drinks or food. You can rent loungers in the sun or shade. Great spot

title: Worth the steps
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Located a short ride out of town, at the bottom of a long flight of stairs is this gorgeous little cove. If you are looking for a private beach or serenity this isn't really it, the beach is full of little restaurants and bars, each with their own strip of sun loungers and tables. But it was the perfect spot to spend the day for us, we arrived early, rented a some sunloungers and an umbrella for the day, rented some snorkel gear and spent the day swimming, snorkeling, napping in the shade and eating from the delicious restaurants. It wasn't crazy busy and was a great spot for spending the day in the ocean.

title: Best beach in Puerto Escondido!!
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Best spot to grab a lounge chair and swim and snorkel the day away.
You can grab drinks and the water is very calm for swimming.
Bit of a hike back up the stairs but worth it.

title: Overcrowded in high season
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful beach but very overcrowded in high seasons. Around midday you feel like a sardine, toe to toe with a lot of other tourists. We left after 20 min to go to La Punta

title: Super pretty, but crowded beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is a beautiful little bay that gets overrun with people. The small crescent bay/beach is completely filled with little restaurants that have their tables and sun chairs with umbrellas that you rent for 250 pesos a day. I would recommend going early in the morning for a nice swim.

title: Beautiful playa!
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido My favorite beach in the area! Lovely waves for surfing, beautiful view and very wild!
Although depending on the tides the beach really reduces so you have to get a sunbed in one of the restaurant and they are not cheap! So my advice is to check the tide if you’re planning on just going to chill at the beach and not surfing!

title: Gorgeous stairway...
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is just an amazing beach.  While you walk down the stairs that view captures all of your senses.  I keep coming to this spot it makes me fall in love again and again.

title: Jewel Beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This small beach is a little jewel.   The cove is protected and the water very swimmable.   There were also kids learning to surf.   Don't let the 167 stairs down and up deter you.   Lots of places to relax under and umbrella and have refresment.

title: Stunning
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Really amazing beach, great waves, chilled atmosphere.  Chairs and umbrellas for rent, or walk to the right for some shade is it’s not busy.  Went to this beach 3 times out of our 8 day stay in the area.

Don’t eat the food, bring your own snacks but ok to buy the drinks from the restaurants onsite.

No vendors, no music just raw beauty

title: Plastic chairs and people
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido I am living and working in Puerto Escondido and have only recently moved here. So far this has been my least favourite beach in Puerto Escondido. I read that this beach is generally quiet due to the number of steps you have to climb but I went on a weekday and it was packed.  Conversely, Zicatela which has a reputation for being crowded has been gorgeous and very peaceful. Even though Carrizalillo is only a small bay, there are lots of restaurants in a row all squashed together. I decided to seat myself at one of the tables but the owner bellowed "no servicio," so I moved to another on the left side. This one was friendlier and chilled. Beer $35 MXN a bottle. The beach is indeed beautiful, but unfortunately you can't really see it due to all the plastic furniture.

title: Beautiful beach, beautiful view
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido When you arrive you'll see a majestic view from the top, then you need to go down close to a 200 step down stair. The beach is beautiful and peaceful for swimming. You can find other activities as well, this a good beach for surf beginners and family time.

title: Packed but beautiful!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The view and the waves are amazing! It was a little bit packed but the vibe was super chilled and everybody was enjoying the waves.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We loved everything about Carrizalillo beach. It is beautiful and the waves are slightly strong in a very fun way. I wouldn't recommend it for small kids but otherwise this place is perfect! If you are a confident swimmer it is also a fun place to swim a few laps!

title: Side by side lounger ghetto
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Absolutely beautiful from cliff side restaurant. Descend down to a crowded unpleasant mess. Each little ‘restaurant’ lines its front with make-shift loungers that leave no space to even see the water from tables behind them. Charge is anywhere between 200-500 pesos, which some apply to food and drink, and other don’t. Beach is small. Don’t know why surfers still insist on coming here, as waves suck. This beach was probably one of the most beautiful in its day, but now ... disappointing.

title: What to say but read the review
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido My partner and I hired surfboards from the rental shop on the beach. The surf was quite busy out, especially at the break. In front of the break was a surf lesson with probably 10-12 people in a horizontal line taking up a huge portion of the surfable water. On my first wave I got shouted at by one of the guides saying if I came close to the lesson again he would kill me. No lie. A death threat after catching a wave. I wasn't even relatively close to the lesson considering how many people were in the water. The next time I caught a wave, again he threatened me and swore at me. Other instructors would start shouting at my partner when she began paddling for waves. Overall, it was a pretty nasty experience if you want to surf there. As for swimming, the water can be very strong and rough. A lady was hanging in the shorebreak and fell over, got pulled back and dumped back onto the beach. Myself and 5 others had to carry her from the water so she didn't get pulled back out and repeated. It is a very picturesque beach. However for these factors and the fact that there is almost no room to sit unless you're paying to sit in a lawn chair I would prefer to go elsewhere. Oh yeah one last thing. Unsure whether it was the water or not although it very well may have been but after swallowing some both my partner and I had the worst night in our lives. I got no sleep and spent the whole night excretting liquid from both ends, entirely emptying my stomach many times.

title: Fun chill place for beginner surfers and longboarding..
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Can get really crowded, if you are an intermediate surfer you might not enjoy. Great for beginners because the paddle out is so easy and waves are chill...

title: Wonderful beach
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We spent many hours on this playa. The water is warm, buoyant and perfect for swimming (which amounted to floating, most of the time). There are beach chairs that you can rent two at a time. I believe they offer a deal if you buy food and drinks there. I think we ordered coconuts, pina coladas and cervezas one of our stays here. 

At one point some locals found a cache of baby sea turtles that they rounded people on the playa up to see. They released the turtles on the beach and we watched as they made their way into the ocean. All free of charge. 

We went on a boat trip where the knowledgeable guide told us that Carrizalillo has a fresh water spring nearby. This is where people used to get their water supply from, years ago. 

We hope to go back here at the earliest opportunity.

title: Nice but very crowded
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This beach is nice for swimming, tanning and surfing. The waves were quite strong but you could still go for a swim. The beach  is quite crowded with a lot of restaurants that provide loungers for a fee.

title: Surfing and swimming
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This beach is beautiful for swimming and SURF LESSONS. If you have your own gear and are trying to get out on a wave I would recommend Punta Zicatela. The waves are bigger there but less locals. A local in the water at Playa Carrizalillo grabbed my surf shirt by the collar and said "you broke my board are you going to pay for it?" Also, "give me your board because you broke my board". After I calmly told this local I was not going to pay for either his board, nor give him mine, he said "get out of these waters, this beach is for locals only". I had surf lessons all week from a local guide and the first day I went alone this local surfer freaked out on me because I was on the wave he wanted to ride. Would not recommend this beach if you want to surf with your own gear or without a local guide.

title: A long  walk down.  163 steps to a perfect beach.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful small enclosed beach.  No rip tides.  Waves normally are not real big. Many venders on the beach for food and drink.  Also lounge chairs with an unbrella for a small fee.  Some say best beach in Puerto but 163 steps down and then up.

title: Great nice, small beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido To arrive at this beach, you need to take some stairs, but once you start descending,  you have a great view at the beach, is small,  beautiful and with waves so that you can surf. At the beach you can find restaurants and all service which you need once at the beach. Have fun and you sunscreen!

title: Gorgeous beach!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We enjoyed the beauty of the speech of the only downfall was the steep steps leading down to it and the lack of running water for bathrooms. There are lots of restaurants beachside and you can pay to use a reclining chair for the day!

title: Great Day at the Beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is a great beach for children.  The waves are big enough for them to play, but not so big it is dangerous.  There are surf lessons, food to purchase and chairs to rent.  You can also rent paddle boards or even go snorkeling.  The sand is hot and the water is cold.  If you swim out deep enough you may run into a sea turtle.  Definitely worth the trek down and up the stairs.

title: Nice beach for swimming
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Nice beach for swimming or paddle boarding, for $250 pesos you can rent a lounger with umbrella. It can be crowded sometimes. Only downside is the stairs up after a long day in the sun and porta potties.

title: Relaxing beach!
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful beach, can be a little busy at times but we still enjoyed it. Depending on the day/ time the waves can still be decent size, but it was the safest we felt swimming.
There are a few food spots on the beach, but we brought some coronas with us and all was well. 
Bring a cooler if you’re staying for the day, as you won’t want to be running up and down the stairs more than you have to.

title: Beautifuy and breezy!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Though it's hot and humid in Puerto, you can stay cool under the palms on this beach. It will cost you 250-300 pesos for a lounge chair (camas), but if you eat you can stay all day at the tables. We thought the price on the lounges with umbrellas was a bit high, and you really need an umbrella, so we took a table. If you stay for a few hours, the price of the lounges isn't bad.

title: AMAZING!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Great Beach, low surf for swimming, but the stairs are a B*tch!   People do surf here sometimes, but I would think it is just for beginners, b/c I did not witness any huge waves.  However while dining at Espidine the evening before, I could look down and see ppl surf here.

title: Great beach!  Head down the steps to a delightful experience.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Gentle waves and no riptide with a  beautiful bay.  There were many people dispersed nicely - friendly atmosphere!

title: Nice beach!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Nice low tide, easy to go swimming or learn to surf. Very crowded however we went on a long weekend. Good food and relaxing day. About 170 stairs to walk down to get to the beach. Then at the end of the day you have to walk back up, but well worth it!!

title: Beautiful Beach - Great Memories!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We loved this smaller beach - enjoyed it so much we went 3 days in a row (at various times)  Mornings are less busy and water is just as warm.  We rented umbrellas and chairs from the various restaurants and ate lunch or dinner there too. There are outhouses for 5 pesos at one of the restos near the main stair.  My 7 yr old had a lifejacket on most of the time as he is not a great swimmer yet.  Neither am I so it took a while for us to get used to the waves as we haven't been to many ocean beaches before!  (Waves apparently get stronger in March - whereas Nov - Feb are more calm)  If you are like us, it's better to wade right in to the water than to stand where the water comes up on the beach - as the pull of the water is surprisingly strong there.  Once you are in the water, you can ride the waves.  My husband and my son both took surf lessons on this beach.  Although I was a bit hesitant for my son, they assured me that someone would be with him the entire time and they are trained to work with kids.  They were great with him and he loved the experience.  He ended up doing another lesson the next day.  They even saw 1 of the 3 sea turtles that live near the beach during their lesson! It's truly a beautiful beach!

title: Great beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful cove with beginners surfing. 167 step down (and back up) to get to it. Rent the surfboard at the bottom. Chairs with umbrellas for $10 a day.

title: Swimming here is beyond fabulous
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido I have been swimming with my Carrizalillo swim group for about 5 years each winter. It is the most wonderful group and ocean swim I have ever experienced. And, I used to do triathlons, so I have open water swims to compare this one to! It’s just perfect water ( most of the time). Today was so clear you could see every little fish. One year we put our heads under the water and heard a mother whale talking to her baby, and the baby answering! Now that’s incredible!!

title: Playa Carrizalillo is a Beach Surrounding a Turqoise Pacific Ocean Bay
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Once you walk down the safe cement and rock stairway you arrive at a beach having all you need for a delightful day. Excellent for swimming and snorkling or lounging on cushy beach lounges with umbrellas, eating and drinking with foods from several restaurants. The scenery of rocky, plant festooned slopes, the sun, the crystal water, the sand, and ocean will make you think you might just have found paradise.

title: Best place to swim
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Had a wonderful time at this beach. Most beaches in this area, unless you are a string swimmer are a little to rough with under tows for the novice to swim. So great to bob in the waves and enjoy the warmth of the Pacific Ocean. You can also enjoy watching the surfers a little further out . Great beach !!

title: beautiful beach in spite of 166 steps to get there
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido beautiful water. quiet beach with some waves but safe to swim. For $300 pesos which goes towards consumption you can hire a table and chairs under the shade

title: Simply the best .......
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Love this beach .... around 175 steps down (which means up) to this fantastic little bay. No boats which makes for nice and quite relax at the beach .... Love it !!

title: Worst restaurant ever!!!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We ate at carizalillo bar which is on the left of the beach when watching the sea. We paid 200 pesos for ceviche that were impossible to eat because too spicy. Since we had asked for not spicy we asked for a reduction. That is when the waiter threatened us to call the cops and told us « franceses de mierda ». Worst expérience ever!!!!

title: Nice beach for beginners surfing lessons
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Hidding below a nearly endless flight of stairs, it is only when leaving the beach you hate them. The beach itself is nice and a little less touristy than Zicatella and El Punto, but it still has beach restaurants with cocktails and they offer surfing lessons.

title: Beautiful
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido One of the few swimming beaches, accessible only by a set of 167 steps. Didn't seem hard to do, but clearly not for the mobility challenged! The access is well maintained and the beach is worth the trek. Bathroom facilities tend to be outhouses, and the restaurants seemed overpriced (we didn't eat there). We brought our own umbrella, towels and spent many lovely hours there.

title: Playa Carrizalillo
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is a lovely beach that offers food, drink and toilets and is often busy.  Surfing lessons go on most days so fun and entertaining to watch.

title: Turquoise Waters
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Such a beautiful beach! As everyone knows, its like 100 stairs to get down and back up from there but it doesn't stop a lot of people from visiting this amazing beach because the stairs are totally worth it! It's a much smaller beach so it is often pretty crowded. The water is awesome and the waves aren't nearly as big as at Zicatella so it's much better for swimming and families with young kids.

title: Awesome view!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is a beautiful beach!...lots of steep stone stairs down to the beach...and...back up! Worth the stairs for the view!

title: Love it!
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We spent a lot of time here during the week (not at the weekend).  We were here in early December and the beach was not crowded.

There are sunbeds and parasols for hire but there is also room in front of them if you don't want to hire a sunbed and just want to lie on your towel.  There were far fewer hawkers here than on Playa Zicatella etc..

The beach is small but we loved it.  It’s safe to swim in the bay and while we were there, on two days, we were joined by turtles who swam very close to us.  An amazing experience.

Just be aware of the steep climb up a lot of steps at the end of the day.

title: Vacation
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Fun and beautiful beach for all ages come and learn how to surf or just get a tan with good sea food shacks all along the beach.

title: Soft samd amd clear water
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Spent the afternoon on the beach enjoying lunch and cervasas.  Quite a few steps up and down to get to the beach but it was worth it.

title: spent 6 hours swimming and it was awesume
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido wonderful beach day.  must spend 300 pesos to get a chair and shade , but that is not hard to do if you are eating.

title: Very beautiful beach, but it can get crowded during high season
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The key to enjoying this beach is to get there before noon -- especially during high season, when it can get astonishingly crowded. But the physical location is stunningly beautiful, and it's a lovely spot to hang out. Note that there are quite a few steps to go up and down to access the beach, but there are food and drink vendors at the bottom which is nice.

title: Beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The beach is nice.not very high waves for swimming. The food not to bad. But the 164 stairs.going down is ok but going back up could be challaging. I would recommend it. The view is awsome.

title: Best beach to chill
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful beach located in a small bay.  Perfect to relaxe and swim, as it drops quickly to deeper water without too much currents. 
Sometimes, you can surf there, but not in January, really.  
Avoid going on weekends as it gets crowdy. 
And, get ready to pay 200 pesos if you want to lay on a chair!  Buying a consommation is not enough.

title: I visit this beach once a week...it is amazing.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido I love that you can swim out a long way and the water is Sooo warm.  I also love that you have 150 stairs to go up when you leave - cause I get my exercise.  The cantinas have simple tasy food and lots of cold beer.  Life is good.tasty

title: Fantastic place to spend an afternoon
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Waters are pretty calm and super warm.  Work a deal like 200pesos on the lounges and bring your own coolers of beer and sofa.

title: My Favorite Beach in PE
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Carrizalillo is my favorite beach in PE. Make sure you get there early, or you might not get a good set of chairs. Bring cash for drinks and food on the beach.

title: Too crowded
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Went here during the end of December. Was way too busy, felt like we were in an indian beach given how many people were theee. Can avoid

title: Crowded, but great for swimming
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is a tiny beach, but the shelf drops off quickly and the waves are gentle, which makes it good for a swim.

title: Top 10 most beautiful beaches
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This beach has got to be up there in my top 10 most beautiful beaches I have ever come across. Maybe not ideal for anyone with a push chair, wheelchair or elderly person as you have do go down quite a few flights of stairs in order to get down to the beach. But if there is any way that you can, then it’s definately worth it! 
The water is crystal clear and a gorgeous turquoise colour. The beach looks a bit like a cove in the way that it is surrounded by cliffs, which for some reason gives it a safe feeling. There are a few little bars/ cafes where you can get something to eat if you get hungry while down there (we didn’t go to any of these so can’t comment on what they were like). 

PThe photos attached to this review really don’t do the beach any justice, it was just incredible! Water was a refreshing temperature but it does get deep fairly quickly so be a bit more careful if you’re taking children there. We would end the day there by watching the sun set and it is such a beautiful sight. Everyone just sits and enjoys/ takes it all in. It made me feel somewhat at peace just relaxing on this stunning beach while watching the sun set for the day.

title: Amazing!!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Swim here, lounge here, enjoy the beauty here. Amazing place to go swimming, snorkelling and relax! However, stairs are killer, prepare !

title: Small beach with great vibe
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Great place to go during the week if you wanna feel local vibe.

Plenty of restaurants and shops a few steps from the beach.

One of the safest beaches for swimming especially with kids.

As this place is tiny, a avoid to go on Sunday as locals are off and therefore gets jam packed by the end of the morning.

Amazing view of sunrise and sunset from the cliff.

A good 5 -10 steep walk to go down to the beach itself is required to get there.

title: be ready to fork out lots of money
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido 200 pesos per person, the restaurants took the whole beach. You cannot even find a spot to sit down without paying. If it's your first time you can go down the 250 stairs to check it out the view is amazing. Used to be a little paradise 5-6 years ago but now they completely ruined it. Go down half the stairs and look at the view or else just don't go.

title: Beautiful Beach and surroundings!!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Attended Playa Carrizalillo on two occasions this past stay in Puerto Escondido.  We enjoyed it so much the first visit, we had to go back to enjoy another afternoon at the beach.  Swimming, surfing, paddle boarding,and relaxing. Water and sand are beautiful. Great service with the food vendors set up at the beach.  We can't wait to get back!

title: Cosy beach
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Really cosy beach, but gets flooded at 5PM :)
Really great to swim in this beach, but not recommended for children.

title: granny learned to surf
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido one of the best beaches i have ever seen to learn to surf.the break is soft but the waves still have power.
nice wide sandy beach a few spot to snorkel.watch out for beginning surfers.the food shack on the far east end were the surf school is has great guac and quesadillas

title: Beautiful Beach
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This beach is worth the steep and long staircase entry. You will marvel at the views as you descend!

Great bay for a day trip of lounging, swimming and surfing (season permitting)! We had great food and service at La Palapa de Rosis.

One issue, clean bathrooms are a challenge. We recommend prior to the descent trying one of the restaurants on the street above called Benito Juárez! Don't forget about the bakery!

title: Love this spot
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful gem and beginner surf spot, slow rolling waves, really fun.  It gets crowded fairly fast, enjoyed sunset here as well

title: Beautiful, #1 for beginner surfers
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Coral based sand. Several food and drink shacks, a man sells oysters by the dozen. Beer costs 30 pesos, sodas 25 pesos. Chair rental without food or drink purchase is 200 pesos. It gets very busy on the weekends and try and find out the Hightide/Lowtide info before renting a surf board. You can rent a board on the beach 100 pesos per hour, 300 pesos per day until 6 pm. A very scenic view!

title: Cracking beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Such a nice beach, worth the steps. Great waves to mess about it, few places to get food and drinks, loungers for 75 pesos. Can rent surf boards too. Go up to Espadin for a drink during sunset! Amazing.

title: Beach turning bad, people are smoking and disrespecting nature
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This beach used to be my favorite....now, it just makes me sad because people are polluting it, smoking cigarettes, playing loud music, leaving beer bottles around....

This used to be a special place that I loved....now I just feel disappointed. Too many jerks disrespecting the beach. 

Go to Playa Entrega instead....you can swim, you can snorkel and there is amazing fish. It’s cleaner too. 

Or playa oregano....very deserted, but beautiful to swim.

title: Nicest beach/cove in Puerto Escondido
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Nicest beach in Puerto Escondido. Well sheltered with lots of surfers and simple bars/restaurants right on the sand along the half moon shaped cove framed by rocks. Long access stairwell to get there.

title: BEACH WITH WAVES
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful small beach with lovely sand. You can go there by taxi from Puerto Escondido.
It has waves and surfers training. You can chill in the cafes and have a good time. We were there in August- October 2017, the water was always warm. Do not use headscarves or sunglasses while swimming, the waves will grab them. Have a great time.

title: Top spot
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido In Puerto Escondido the best place if you want to swim. Small bay in which one also wants to make his first steps as a beginner on the surfboard. Nevertheless, one should not underestimate the surf.

title: Nice beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Amazing beach in a bay where you can swim among surfers and turtles, but the stairs to the beach may turn away older people. Restaurants on the beach are quite simple.

title: Worth every step!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This place is a beautiful cove, part of the greater area of Puerto Escondido. I took a surfing lesson there, then stayed there the rest of the day!  They have different restaurants with palapas, you have the option of paying for the palapa use or eat at the restaurant then you can stay without paying extra.  Because of its accessibility, it doesn't get crowded and it makes it a thing to do.  You can only get there thru a stairway...which is not that bad!  The restrooms are a trip, they have public ones, you pay 5 pesos for each visit, they are as clean as they can get!  People are very nice, friendly and accommodating.  After my surf lesson, wanted to change, there were no real dressing rooms but the gentlemen offered his storage room where he kept his boards as an alternative! Worth every step!

title: Perfect to go swim and start surfing!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido It's a small but super nice beach, the only thing we didn't like is that most of the places charge you 200 pesos for sunbeds and umbrella. there is one place at the end of the beach that let you use the sun beds for all day if you consume 350 pesos with them and they were very nice.

title: Beatiful beach.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Very pretty beach, nice and quiet spot for relaxing and swimming without risk of drowning because of the big waves from the open sea. The thing is that the restrooms are horrible, stinky and dirty, and you even have to pay! Beside that, very nice spot.

title: Crowded and local surfers own it.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Overcrowded with restaurants. Surf guides think they own the break. Seen someone get their wave only to have an instructor push in front and get hit by his board, cut his cheek, then this bloke was surrounded by instructors claiming it was his fault and he had to go to hospital with the instructor to pay for his stitches.. rocks in the break so beware at low tides. Good break otherwise and sheltered beach for swimming.

title: Use to be magical, now taken by retaurants
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Is a very nice and small beach, surrounded by rocks, with beautiful turquoise water and nice not to wild waves. Now all the space has been invaded by chairs, sand beds and umbrellas, that are rented for the day. The place is crowded with people and chairs and you could not even walk. The water is surprisingly dirty, because other beaches in Puerto are really clean. A shame ... :(

title: Serene and beautiful!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Looking for a chill beach to take a book and read?  Learn to surf or catch some waves in this lovely bay?  Do not miss Playa Carrizalillo!  Be ready to walk down a series of stone stairs and save some energy to walk up!

title: You choose your wave size
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Super views, water calm, clean beach and very friendly people. A real experience.  will return.
Good access with stairs

title: Beautiful hang out place, lot of work to go there and up
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido It is beautiful, however the stairs to get to, and back up, are a really work out, really good food, nice enviroment.

title: Beautiful and low key cove
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We spent at least part of 3 of our 4 beach days in Puerto Escondido here. The ocean is warm and the colors are more vibrant than a lot of Pacific beaches are. Great to hang out all day, enjoy the water, and just chill.

title: Nice day spot or to learn surfing
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido It pretty much very hot from 11am till 4pm so grab one of the lounge chairs and umbrellas.  Drinks and food are a bit pricey so you can bring some or at least water yourself.   You can rent a surfboard or get a lesson, sometimes its crowded.   The part you can stand is not deep, and the part you swim in is very.  And the sun sets behind the mountain.  For best sunset, go to Coral Beach from 5pm or a few hours before, no umbellas or stands there, but a bit easier to sit in the water, decent snorkeling, and careful of the rocks....

title: By Far Best Beach in PE!!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We go to this beach multiple times when we visit.  We rent chairs and then we surf, we play frisbee, boogie board, swim, hangout, drink, eat ice cream, and more.  The people that offer these services are kind and not pushy. We will continue to go back for many more years!!

title: Nice little beach for surfing and swimming.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Went to this beach a few times during a surf camp. Very relaxed and quiet. Good for families. No loud annoying beach clubs. While there is still an active surf here it is smaller than the other local beaches.

title: Great surfing for kids
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Our kids 7and 11 took surf lessons here and the waves are perfect for the beginner.  The beach is quaint and casual and away from the hustle of the main beach.  We loved this beach.

title: First Time Surfing
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We went and took our first surf lesson then enjoyed a fruit plate for breakfast.  The area is nice but busy and not for long beach walks but watching the surfing is very enjoyable.

title: Best beach we've ever been to
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Best beach Andrea and I have ever visited!

We have been to Maui, many in Florida, Belize, Cancun, etc.

Gorgeous!  Great waves, crystal clear waters, cool international crowd.  So much fun watching all the surfers!

It's a small, so I could imagine at the wrong time of year it could get overly packed.

Service at the palapa we used was awesome!

title: The place to go!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Loved going to Playa Carrizalillo.  We spent a month in Puerto Escondido and went to P.C. at least 8 times.  You can purchase food/drinks/lounge chairs or you can bring your own.  We usually brought our own.  Beach was beautiful and clean.  Lots to do there - surf, bogie board, snorkel, swim or just soak up the sun on the beach. Would go back to it in a heart beat!

title: Beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Steep set of stair down to the beach. Not for the faint of heart. Expensive umbrella charge! And charge for bathroom on top of that! Food reasonably priced.

title: Step arobics in the sun
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Didn't realze there were over 165 stps leading to the beach.  Not really compatable with knee or breathing issues.  Cost was $300 pesos to rent char and umbrella, which can be exchanged higher for food/beverage.  Prices higher than most.

title: Best beach in puerto escondido
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido One of the most picturesque beaches ive been to (and i've been to Tulum, cancun, Thailand, Vietnam, Bahamas, aruba).  The steps are not bad at all- take your time if you need to..there is no rush :) we saw older people going up and down.  

renting a chair is nice but the prices vary between the bars. one place told us $400 pesos for two people and just pay for it in food and drinks. the next day, we went to a different place and it was $200 pesos just to rent (food and drinks were separate).  you could get away without a chair and umbrella but it might be sunny and hot.

The beach can be rough and it gets deep early on but its super fun to swim in. you will see people get rolled around by the strong shore waves. its so fun to watch the surfers.

title: Sun & Surf
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful white beach with lots of restaurants serving cold cervaza on a hot day . You can rent a lounger with shade , sit & laugh & enjoy the great food . The waves & the current can be strong so watch the little ones AND be prepared for the 150 steps down to the beach & back up as well !

title: Our favorite beach in PE
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Very pretty beach, clean water, lots of steps,over 160, easier arriving and leaving, but if you're in OK shape, not a problem.  Definitely worth the effort.

title: Breathtaking view from stairs
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This beach was my favorite of all!
To get to playa carrizalillo you have to take some good stairs, from the stairs the view is AMAZING.
This beach is small not to big but beautiful and simple, they don't have restaurant there so be prepared with your own water and snacks.

title: Themost beautiful Cove
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido From when you come down the 160 steps to the beach until you climb back it is one of the most relaxing settings I have ever experienced. Try the fish tacos at the furthest point to the left as you leave the stairs. They are the best I have ever eaten and Very Cheap. Enjoy this wonderful Place!

title: Quiet compared to others
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido There are some great palapas here, where you can sit and watch the waves tear into the cove. A bit hard to find, but well worth it.

title: Possibly my favoret beach in the world.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Other than the 169 steps down and up to get there, it is fabulous.  The swimming is terrific and there are lovely palapas along the back to provide you with chairs and tables, food and drink.  Swim out towards the ocean, come back and have a coco frio or a beer and lounge back for the afternoon.

title: Beautiful Carrizalillo
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is a gorgeous spot to spend a few hours/a few days/ most or all of your vacation Although it can get quite busy, most people here are very friendly (business people and guests alike). There will always be a welcome spot, get a coconut, a snack , a beer go for a swim, surf, etc. Also contrary to some previous reviews; there are bathrooms, even though they may be a little more 'rustic' than what you are used to (and I think you may have to pay one of the kid 'attendants' the equivalent of .50 cents to use.
Just go and enjoy, it's a great beach !

title: Beautiful, but..
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The beach has a transparent water, waves for beginner’s surfing and amazing view from the stairs where you approach it. 
Sadly, there are no decent bathrooms, it gets crowded from around 12 p.m. and the service is very different from what one can expect of a Mexican place. 
The piña colada inside a real coconut was delicious though!

Bottom line: be prepared to be in crowded place, see overpriced beds and tables, and pee in the sea.

title: Beautiful beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido It was rated as the most swimable beach in the area. The downfall wad that it was ovecrowded to the point that you could not enter the water. I went back to it on my last day at 7am and wish i had done that every day. Simply stunning and only one more tourist around

title: Love this beach, stairs and all
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This is a busy spot for swimming, especially on weekends.  It’s very popular for learning to surf also, so keep your head up! Expect to pay about 250 pesos for lounge chairs, but if you spend that in food and drink it’s all included.

title: Great for Swimming!
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Playa Carrizalillo is great for swimming as the waves are not as big as other beaches. Several restaurants/bar are providing parasols on the beach as long as you purchase food and/or drinks. The prices were very reasonable and the food and drinks were delicious. 
Prior to visiting Playa Carrizalillo, we purchased some body boards from the market which were convenient while swimming in the ocean as we are not the best swimmers; it was lots of fun and very picturesque.

title: My go to beach
text:
Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido The best beach in town- my opinion. The 156 stairs down a 90 meter cliff were no issue( coming up is a good work out). The crescent shaped bay has gentle waves at the shore, no undertow, a a break 100 m from shore for begginer surfers.
Many restaurant options. They ask you spend 200 pesos ($12.00 us) for a covered beach chair or table rental. With lunch and a few drinks it was well worth it.
I went 3 times a week for 3 weeks. It is 5 minutes from Caficito Rinconada

title: Do it, walk the 170 stairs to get here, then up.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Its totally worth the effort, and if the restaurants can carry all those drinks down those stairs you can walk it.  Be sure to stop to look, as walking and looking may get you injured.

title: Wonderful
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This beach was the star of our stay. Clean, quiet with no boom boxes or loud music, except for the sound of the waves. Surprisingly, it had quite a bit of people, kiosks all along, but well taken care.the waves are good , not overwhelming! Loved the place!

title: A hidden gem
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido If you don’t mind a little adventure and 160 stairs down to the beach then this is a “must see” beach.  Warm water with very gentle waves and it stays shallow quite a ways out.  One of the most beautiful beaches in the area.

title: Beautiful spot
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Close to the center of town, lots to do in the area, great views and a really nice walk around the area. Also a safe place to have a dip in the ocean

title: By far the beast beach for swimming and snorkelling in Puerto Escondido
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido It is relatively small but beautiful beach for swimming and snorkelling. No big waves like on Zicatela, crowds like on Puerto Angelito and Manzanillo, and rough access and rocks like on Coral, and polluted water on playa Principal. There are stone steps down to the beach but easily climbed up or down.

title: Perfect, except for those 168 steps back up
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Our favorite beach.  You can pay to have a nice lounger chair under an umbrella.  the beach is not huge but certainly big enough to get in a good swim.  Waves are small, water temperature perfect.  There are a few small places to eat with tables and you also can get drinks on your lounge chair.  Hope to get there one more time before we leave.  Take a cab from Puerto Escondido and ask them to drop you off at Playa Carrizalillo.  Then walk down the 168 steps - with camera ready for the beautiful views.  Gets crowded on weekends.

title: Beauful beach.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Like crystal water. Can see inside of water. Very quite place beach. Very low wave and no deep water. If you travel with kids I will recommend.

title: Walk down is worth it
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Great beach beautiful beach sandy great clear water  a bit of a long walk down but worth it good service .You get table chairs umbrella free if you food and beverage bill is at least 200 pesos really only $13.00 Canadian we spent 4hours

title: Fav. Small swimming beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido In my opinion this little beach is the best for swimming. Since you have to be careful due to open ocean, this little beach gives you security to watch your loved ones in a pls e with fewer waves than other places. For lunch, go to the inky palapa with a second floor

title: small and crowded
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido As its a small beach, its full of people, lots of kids. the few restaurants there ask for a minimum consumption of 300 pesos. So if you want to drink just a beer - forget it.

title: Prettiest Beach Ever
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido If you can manage a huge flight of stairs, the effort is worth it just to experience this sheltered treasure. This small beach offers several restaurants with shaded tables and lounges. A must see in PE.

title: Learning to Surf
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido We had the best time learning to surf with Julio and Negro  they are great to learn with and fun to hang out with also - highly recommended - find them on the beach...

title: Perfect water
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Great swimming - gentle waves, clear water, but arduous stairs! Save your energy for the return up 156 steps!

title: Very calm and beautiful beach.
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Beautiful place to spend a few hours on the beach, however the food is not the best and kind of expensive compared to other restaurants in the area. I would recommend taking water and snacks down there. Getting there is not easy as you have to go through 170 steps down in order to get to the beach.

title: Perfection!
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido This place is incredibly beautiful.  Just walking on the stairs you have a spectacular view.  Definitively a spot to visit.

title: Nice surf spot
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido + nice wave, stunning view,  - too much stairs, too much swiming people! Be careful not to hit someone!

title: Gorgeous water and beach
text: Playa Carazillo Puerto Escondido Quaint secluded beach with aqua blue water. Worth the 160 steps down and back up. Crystal clear water with manicured beach, rental lounge chairs and nice sloping shore. Perfect for swimming, sunbathing and beginning surfing. Vendors offer drinks and food.
